i get this:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Classpath references closed project:
org.eclipse.update.core

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.launching 4 150 Jan 10, 2003 10:33:00.897
!MESSAGE Classpath references closed project: org.eclipse.update.core
closing and reopening that update.core project seems to help
this is only major - there's a workaround
Darin any clue what is going on here?

The code is quite simple - if a runtime classpath entry references a project 
that is closed, we throw the exception. If the project was not closed, then 
something is wrong with the core (I would think). Reproducing it will be the 
key. [I checked to make sure we are checking the IProject for being closed, 
rather than the IJavaProject - we used to have that bug].
Adam do you still have this problem?
Is this related to a bug I just created - 34991?
bug cleanup...haven't heard that this problem occured again - closing
